zh: 政府不得不改变其外交政策。

en: He fooled her.
It's said that Japan's rural landscape has changed greatly.
zh: 据说日本的乡村景观已经发生了很大的变化。

en: He confessed to being a liar.
A square is one type of rectangle, and a rectangle is one type of parallelogram.
zh: 正方形是一种矩形，矩形是一种平行四边形。

en: A parallelogram is a quadrilateral formed from two sets of parallel lines.
zh: 平行四边形是由两组平行线组成的四边形。

en: A square is a quadrilateral with four sides the same and where all four corners are right angles.
zh: 正方形是一个四边形，四条边都一样长，而且四个角都是直角。

en: A crossroads is where two roads meet in an X.
zh: 十字路口是两条路以X形相交的地方。

en: The opposite sides of a parallelogram are parallel.
zh: 平行四边形的对边是平行的。

en: It is essential to prevent salmonella contamination in hen egg production.
zh: 防止母鸡蛋生产中沙门氏菌污染至关重要。

en: He was standing.
"Don't worry," Dima attempted to put the woman at ease. "It's not mine."
zh: “别担心，”迪马试图让这位女士安心。“这不是我的。”

en: Mark in red anything you don't understand and ask about it in class.
zh: 用红色标记出任何你不理解的内容，并在课堂上提问。

en: In many countries, buying or smoking cannabis is forbidden by law.
zh: 在许多国家，购买或吸食大麻是法律禁止的。

en: I picked up a pretty shell at the seaside.
zh: 我在海边捡到一个漂亮的贝壳。

en: I live in Milan.
You eat in the classroom?
Do you eat in the classroom?
My period hasn't come.
Bob said to his friend: "The bird is dead."
zh: 鲍勃对他的朋友说：“鸟死了。”

en: This picture reminds me of my childhood.
zh: 这张照片让我想起了我的童年。

en: I wonder why we have ear lobes.
zh: 我想知道我们为什么有耳垂。

en: I wonder what ear lobes are for.
zh: 我想知道耳垂是做什么用的。

en: I met an otolaryngologist at a party on Sunday.
zh: 我在星期天的聚会上遇到了一位耳鼻喉科医生。

en: I met an ear nose and throat doctor at a party on Sunday.
zh: 我在星期天的聚会上遇到了一位耳鼻喉科医生。

en: My father's admonishment was hard to bear.
zh: 我父亲的告诫令人难以忍受。

en: Mrs Takeda is quick to pick up on the local rumours.
zh: 武田太太很快就听到了当地的谣言。

en: I can sing well.
Kids love pasta in tomato sauce.
zh: 孩子们喜欢番茄酱意大利面。

en: He saw a butterfly on the wall.
zh: 他看到墙上有一只蝴蝶。

en: From the spring equinox the days become longer than the nights, and living creatures are becoming full of life.
zh: 从春分开始，白天比夜晚长，生物也变得充满生机。

en: My big brother shared his cake with me.
zh: 我的哥哥和我分享了他的蛋糕。

en: You're off the hook this time.
This time I'll let it slide.
Let's get the work over with so we can relax.
zh: 让我们尽快完成工作，这样我们就可以放松了。

en: Most of the credit for our success goes to you.
zh: 我们成功的大部分功劳归功于你。

en: While living abroad, you tend to see a variety of strange customs.
zh: 在国外生活的时候，你往往会看到各种各样的奇怪习俗。

en: You shouldn't speak when the teacher is speaking. It's common sense.
zh: 老师说话的时候你不应该说话，这是常识。

en: The hot-blooded are prone to heart attacks.
zh: 热血的人容易得心脏病。

en: Prime Minister Koizumi is certainly not a cold-blooded man.
zh: 小泉首相当然不是一个冷血的人。

en: Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog, it's too dark to read.
zh: 狗的外面，书是人类最好的朋友。狗的里面，太黑了，没法看书。

en: What time do you close?
It took only a 1000 yen to convince him.
zh: 只花了1000日元就说服了他。

en: They have elected a new government.
zh: 他们已经选举了一个新政府。

en: I am an eternal PC-newbie.
It's a concrete bridge, but several places along its length have collapsed.
zh: 这是一座混凝土桥，但是桥身的好几处都塌了。

en: I plan to go skiing in Hokkaido.
It's exactly half-past eight.
Please come again in three days time.
This world is a distant three hundred million light years away from the world where you live.
zh: 这个世界距离你所居住的世界有三亿光年之遥。

en: History is like Quantum Physics, the observer affects the event observed. Is the Kennedy assasination a particle or a wave?
zh: 历史就像量子物理学，观察者会影响被观察的事件。肯尼迪遇刺事件是粒子还是波？

en: If I create an example, will you correct it for me?
zh: 如果我创建一个例子，你会帮我改正吗？

en: I don't give a damn about my CV.
She is well versed in Spanish literature.
I don't suppose it's possible to read a book by moonlight.
zh: 我想在月光下读书是不可能的吧。

en: Start by doing the books.
I think the wind's dropping off.
It's just a dream.
He's a chain smoker.
Please drive the car more slowly.
The majority of Japanese temples are made out of wood.
zh: 大多数日本寺庙都是用木头建造的。

en: A function that is differentiable everywhere is continuous.
zh: 一个处处可微的函数是连续的。

en: China is bigger than Japan.
We have two children.
Locomotives come more often than buses do.
zh: 火车比公共汽车来得更频繁。

en: I don't believe in God.
American forces announced the completion of their mission in Iraq.
zh: 美军宣布完成了在伊拉克的任务。

en: It goes without saying that it was supremely difficult to carry out this mission.
zh: 不用说，执行这项任务极其困难。

en: It must be terribly difficult, running her household on her own after divorcing.
zh: 离婚后独自操持家务，一定非常困难。

en: Can you tell me why you like him?
zh: 你能告诉我你为什么喜欢他吗？

en: I love my motherland.
A friend in hand is worth two in the bush!
zh: 双鸟在林，不如一鸟在手！

en: He went out to eat.
He ate out.
My older brother is planning to work at a drug factory.
zh: 我哥哥计划在一家制药厂工作。

en: I don't have time right now.
Few students attended the meeting.
Although Takahashi looks completely Asian, I've heard he's of mixed blood.
zh: 虽然高桥看起来完全是亚洲人，但我听说他是混血儿。

en: Suffering from terminal cancer, he was thrown out of a certain veteran hospital in New York three times because he adamantly rejected blood transfusions.
zh: 他身患绝症，因为坚决拒绝输血，三次被纽约一家退伍军人医院赶了出来。

en: I saw Jessie standing there.
Today was the school closing ceremony for 2008.
zh: 今天是2008年的学校结业典礼。

en: Fresh-water fish include some designated as protected species. You're not allowed to catch or buy them.
zh: 淡水鱼包括一些被指定为保护物种的鱼类。 你不能捕捉或购买它们。

en: You can add sentences that you do not know how to translate.
zh: 你可以添加你不知道如何翻译的句子。

en: You know what my idiot son's doing? Even now he's graduated from university he spends all his time playing pachinko instead of getting a job.
zh: 你知道我那个笨儿子在干什么吗？ 都大学毕业了，现在还整天玩柏青哥，不去找工作。

en: He chipped the edge of the tea cup.
zh: 他把茶杯的边缘磕掉了。

en: My older brother started to take interest in Japanese folk songs when he was around 12 years old.
zh: 我哥哥在12岁左右开始对日本民歌产生兴趣。

en: Nope.
In Hawaii you can swim in the sea all year.
zh: 在夏威夷，你一年四季都可以下海游泳。

en: My name is Farshad.
Is Mother scolding the horse?
If Cleopatra's nose had been a little lower, the history of the world might have been different.
zh: 如果克娄巴特拉的鼻子再低一点，世界历史可能会有所不同。

en: When I was a kid, I thought that if I died the world would just disappear. What a childish delusion! I just couldn't accept that the world could continue to exist without me.
zh: 小时候，我以为如果我死了，世界就会消失。多么幼稚的幻想啊！我就是无法接受没有我的世界还能继续存在。

en: Lazarus Zamenhof is Polish.
zh: 拉扎鲁斯·扎门霍夫是波兰人。

en: Leave it!
She baked me a cake.
There are only chemicals in that mayo!
zh: 那蛋黄酱里只有化学成分！

en: Many consumers are concerned about the health risks of genetically modified food.
zh: 许多消费者担心转基因食品的健康风险。

en: I was invited by an old friend.
zh: 我是一位老朋友邀请来的。

en: Please do not kill me.
He's my younger brother.
Once the sketch is completed, ink it with a nib pen.
zh: 草图完成后，用蘸水笔描线。

en: We hope to reach the summit before it gets dark.
zh: 我们希望在天黑前到达顶峰。

en: He trimmed his beard for the wedding.
zh: 为了婚礼，他修剪了胡子。

en: I'm scared of big, black, hairy tarantulas!
zh: 我害怕又大又黑又多毛的狼蛛！

en: "You're interested in this sort of thing?" "No, not really."
zh: “你对这种事感兴趣？”“不，其实没有。”

en: Everybody knows the moon is made of cheese.
zh: 大家都知道月亮是奶酪做的。

en: This hamburger is inexpensive for a Japanese hamburger.
zh: 这个汉堡作为日本汉堡来说并不贵。

en: Can you give me your cell number?
zh: 你能把你的手机号码给我吗？

en: Could you please tell me what your cell phone number is?
zh: 请问你的手机号码是多少？

en: Could you tell me your mobile number please?
zh: 请问你的手机号码是多少？

en: My room number is 5.
